text: Pegeen is the anglicized spelling of Peigín, an Irish given name meaning "little Peig/Margaret" and may refer to: * Pegeen Vail Guggenheim (1925–1967), American painter, daughter of art collector Peggy Guggenheim * Brigit Pegeen Kelly (1951–2016), American poet * Pegeen Hanrahan (born circa 1966), mayor of Gainesville, Florida * Pegeen (film), 1920 American film starring Bessie Love * Margaret "Pegeen" Flaherty, character in Irish playwright John Millington Synge's The Playboy of the Western World (1907) * "Peigín Leitir Móir", Irish folk song published in 1911 * Pegeen Prichard 8th grade, science class teacher assistant, 1976-77, Walled Lake Junior High. * Pegeen Fitzgerald (1904–1989) American radio personality ==See also== * List of Irish-language given names ==References== Category:Irish feminine given names
title: Pegeen
